page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF THE DYCE AREA
page.content: Until recently Dyce was a small village six miles north-west of Aberdeen on the A947 and the River Don.It is now an affluent suburb of the city with a population of{7371. Its growth is a result of its{airport and its relationship with the{oil {boom.}The main industries are oil related although there is also a meat processing plant which was estabished in the 1930s. The parish has one secondary school,one primary school and a nursery school.{Services}include a shopping mall with superstore, several smaller shops,two public houses and three large hotels. There is a large area of recreational space beside the River Don.The {countryside}around Dyce is used intensively for agriculture.
